course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Information Systems Control and Assurance
course.description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts and tools to perform information systems (IS) control and assurance.  Topics include IS control standards, guidelines and best practices to protect and control business systems, IT governance frameworks (e.g., COBIT), as well as the latest development in IS management practice.

reviews.author: kaka
reviews.title: IS elective (ISACA requirement course)
reviews.comment_content: A upgraded course for 4100. Mainly teaching IS securities stuff. Have similar content with 4100. There is not much that need to be memorized. You just need to understanding the concepts and do some CISA questions to familiar yourself with the topic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Most people say Percy is one of the best teachers in UST. He really cares a lot about his students. And he uses many examples to explain the difficult concepts. However, he always adds many notes that are not provided in the powerpoint. Students always need to write a lot during lessons, which is quite annoying.

If you are not free to go to lesson, make sure you watch the lecture videos at the end of the semester. Otherwise, you may miss sth important that is not stated int he powerpoint.
reviews.comment_grading:
Just like other IS courses, the grade is quite good. If you are around mean, you can get a B.
p.s. I get a B+
reviews.comment_workload: Not quite a lot workload. One of the least workload courses I had in UST. Only a quiz(mid-term) and a final are required. No project and assignments!

reviews.author: u1s1t8
reviews.comment_content:
This is a course all about IS Auditing.Suitable for students planning to take the Certified Information System Auditor (CISA) examination.
Main Topics include:
  1.Introduction to IT Auditing
  2.Auditing Change Management
  3.IT Service Delivery and Support
  4.Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery
  5.Protection of Information Assets
reviews.comment_teaching: Percy is good. He asked lots of questions during class to ensure we all understand the concepts clearly. You'd better answer his questions or else he'll keep on asking until someone get the answer correctly. He also encourages students to ask him questions after class and he usually responds quickly.
reviews.comment_grading: Scored around 89% for the first 3 group assignments (acct for 70% of the grade). The score for the final individual assignment is unknown. Got a C+ at last.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload in this semester. Just 4 assignments (cases) overall, and each takes around 1-2 days to finish. Answers are all available from the lecture slides. And 3/4 assignments are group assignments.

reviews.comment_content: This course is for the student who is interested in ISACA exam. The content is quite boring if you are not pursuing an ISACA certificate or working in IT auditing. It's useless in daily life.
reviews.comment_teaching: Percy is quite a good professor I have met. He could patiently explain the concepts to students. He is a profession in ISACA exam. Everyone was impressed by his interesting teaching style. He is full of passion.

reviews.comment_content: not very organized i'd say, but it's interesting to know

reviews.author: lmk
reviews.title: Great course but fair grading
reviews.comment_content:
The ISACA content.
The IS audit process.
BCP and DP.
System changeover.
Risk management and control.
reviews.comment_teaching: Percy is the best professor I have met. He could explain the concepts very well and interesting. He always helps student in many ways like providing career advises and extra materials for ISACA exam. You can learn a lot in his lecture and feel interesting. He could make the content of IS Auditing in a common sense way which could greatly help you to understand it. Some MC exercise will be provided for practicing.
reviews.comment_grading:
As there is lecture video and the content is not much, the competition is very intense. Students in this course is generally hardworking as they might take this course for the preparation of the ISACA exam.

Midterm - below 0.5 SD
Final - unknown. I think I could score above mean.

Final Grade - B
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. Only a midterm and a final and the content is not much. However, you need to understand the concepts clear as the exam is testing your understanding instead of memorization. If you want to score a higher grade, you are encouraged to find some exercise in the internet for practicing.

reviews.author: ust2017
reviews.title: Super nice grade!
reviews.comment_content: All about IS audit and CISA exam. It would be a very informative and useful course if you intend to take the CISA exam. However, if you do not plan to do so, the content is quite unpractical in real life. For example, it teaches how to ensure company's normal operation during disasters like earthquake, or how to manage data security for a company. Overall, the concept is quite easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Percy is a nice professor! He will give you his WhatsApp and WeChat on the first lesson and he is willing to answer all of your questions. He emphasised interactions so he always raise questions during lessons. Better to answer his questions if you know it or else he will keep on asking and asking the same questions until somebody gets it XD
Samuel is super nice too! (I guess every IS-major buddy should have already knew it? XD)
reviews.comment_grading:
Incredibly good. 4 assignments in total.
1st assignment: 18%
2nd assignment: 27%
3rd assignment: 25%
4th assignment: 30%
I scored nearly full for the first 2, around 80% for the 3rd one. Last assignment was not released. I got an A finally.
reviews.comment_workload: I was taking this course during the online-teaching semester, so Percy cancelled all midterms or finals, and only 4 assignments are used to determine the grade. The first 3 assignments are group assignments (a case study), each has around 7-8 questions which were all based on the same case. The last one is individual-based. Each consumed around 1-2 days. (They usually offer 2 weeks for 1 assignment which is far more than enough). They are not difficult to handle, you just have to spend sometimes to look for the answers from lectures notes, since basically all the questions are so straight-forward.

reviews.author: Zeta
reviews.comment_content: 內容圍繞IS Audit既工作範圍、程序、Methodology。上Percy堂要聽足佢講書同抄足notes，因為就咁睇佢既PPT係無辦法自學。但只要上堂有俾心機，會發覺content係好容易。但有一樣野要注意，就係好多時會混亂左IS同IS Audit既知識，其實佢兩樣都會教，但係exam一定係以IS auditor既身份做出發點，所以記得，無時無刻都要當自己係一個auditor黎看待所有material，咁樣先可以事半工倍。
reviews.comment_teaching: Percy人超好，本身就係IS既UG program coordinator，會好關心學生既進度。佢PPT既style係，每逢去到一d重要既concept，佢都會俾幾個example大家試下，即場講答案，確保所有人都明白先會落下一個topic。有任何野唔明都可以趁break問佢，佢一定會盡力答你。
reviews.comment_grading: 兩個quiz一個final，出題按CISA Exam程度出，其實係考你心思細唔細密。本人A range，但其他人就唔知。
reviews.comment_workload: 可能Summer關係，其實除左quiz exam以外都真係冇乜野要你做，最多有時叫你上堂前睇定少少material(但其實你唔睇佢都會go through一次)，考試前要溫既野都唔算好多，講到底，佢要你understand就可以。
